author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) said Saturday she plans to introduce a bill aimed at tackling "weather modification." “I am introducing a bill that prohibits the injection, release, or dispersion of chemicals or substances into the atmosphere for the express purpose of altering weather, temperature, climate, or sunlight intensity. It will be a felony offense,”...
title: Greene to introduce ‘weather modification’ bill

author: Julia Mueller
description: Republicans are eyeing potential redistricting opportunities in Ohio and Texas as they seek extra cushion to protect their thin majority in the House next year.   In Ohio, redistricting laws mandate a redraw ahead of 2026 because the last map passed without bipartisan support. And in Texas, redistricting could be added to an upcoming special session...
title: GOP eyes redistricting in Ohio and Texas as it looks to bolster slim majority

author: Rick Willis, opinion contributor
description: Federal programs that support people with brain injury, such as HEADS UP and the National Concussion Surveillance System, are facing serious cuts that could leave survivors without hope and increase the risk of developing devastating conditions later in life.
title: Out of sight, out of mind: Without federal support, brain injury survivors will be left behind

author: Eric R. Mandel, opinion contributor
description: Israel's strikes on Iran's missile production sites were aimed at preventing a catastrophic escalation of Iran's missile threat, and a nuclear-only deal with Iran that ignores this threat could embolden the regime and lead to further instability in the region.
title: Iran nuclear deal without missile limits is a strategic mistake

author: Kurt Davis Jr., opinion contributor
description: Being anti-establishment is a powerful stance — until you become the establishment.
title: Zohran Mamdani tapped into real frustration in New York. That doesn’t mean he can govern.

author: Filip Timotija
description: NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte praised President Trump’s commitment to the military alliance during a recent interview and said the president deserves credit for pushing the 32-nation members to spend more of their gross domestic product on defense.  Rutte, in an interview with The New York Times released Saturday, said he is “confident of the fact...
title: NATO chief praises Trump's commitment to alliance

author: Filip Timotija
description: A group of five Democratic state lawmakers in Florida said they were denied entry to “Alligator Alcatraz,” a new migrant detention facility, on Thursday due to “safety reasons,“ days after President Trump toured the facility alongside Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R).  The lawmakers who tried to tour the facility, which opened on Tuesday, included state...
title: Florida Democrats denied entry to 'Alligator Alcatraz' after Trump visit

author: Addy Bink
description: If you were impacted by a pair of massive data breaches that targeted AT&T customers, you could be in line to receive part of a settlement totalling $177 million.
title: AT&T agrees to $177M settlement over data breaches: What to know

author: Brian Farrell
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger, former California governor and actor, was the keynoe speaker at a naturalization ceremony at Mount Vernon on July 4.
title: Arnold Schwarzenegger lays wreath at George Washington's tomb at Mount Vernon

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: Social engineering attacks are incredibly common. Can you avoid being a victim?
title: Are you susceptible to a 'social engineering' attack?

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump said he will begin negotiations with China about a potential deal regarding the popular video-sharing platform TikTok this upcoming week.  “We pretty much have a deal. I think we are gonna start Monday or Tuesday asking, talking to China, perhaps President Xi [Jinping] or one of his representatives, but we pretty much have...
title: Trump: China talks about TikTok deal to begin next week

author: Aris Folley
description: Republicans are defending recent legislation aimed at incentivizing states to fight erroneous payments through the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) — but Democrats are picking a fight over a last-minute change they argue encourages states to have higher error rates. Legislation passed out of the GOP-led Congress on Thursday that could see some states pay...
title: Democrats pick fight over how GOP’s SNAP change hits states

author: Jeff Arnold
description: ICE's detention budget will more than double due to the funding designated for the agency in the bill passed by Congress
title: How $45 billion in 'big, beautiful bill' funding aids ICE detention

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk on Friday leaned into his proposal for a third party amid his growing feud with President Trump over the "big, beautiful" spending and tax bill with an Independence Day poll online. Hours before Trump signed the sprawling reconciliation package into law, Musk asked followers on social platform X whether he should...
title: Musk doubles down on third party threat with Independence Day poll
